body_html:
@LukaOo I noticed that too, and in any case, cuDNN does not work On windows in the latest release, therefore I usetorch.backends.cudnn.enabled=False otherwise, nothing works for me.

There is also: # print('__CUDNN VERSION:', torch.backends.cudnn.lib.cudnnGetErrorString())
body_text:
@LukaOo I noticed that too, and in any case, cuDNN does not work On windows in the latest release, therefore I usetorch.backends.cudnn.enabled=False otherwise, nothing works for me.
There is also:  # print('__CUDNN VERSION:', torch.backends.cudnn.lib.cudnnGetErrorString())
body:
@LukaOo I noticed that too, and in any case, cuDNN does not work On windows in the latest release, therefore I use```torch.backends.cudnn.enabled=False``` otherwise, nothing works for me.

There is also: ``` # print('__CUDNN VERSION:', torch.backends.cudnn.lib.cudnnGetErrorString())```
